intro: Berinia acuminata, commonly known as the narrowleaf berinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens.
